title: Thou shalt have no other gods before me
summary: "Thou shalt have no other gods before Me" is one of the Ten Commandments found in the Hebrew Bible at Exodus 20:2 and Deuteronomy 5:6.[1] It is the central tenet of the Abrahamic religions and prohibits the religion's followers from worshipping gods other than the Lord.[fn 1] The sin of worshipping another god is called idolatry.[2] Historically, the punishment for idolatry was often death.
